column4: hi, I want to add ubuntu next to my windows installation,  can I just download and install it  ?
should I check the box next to the "alternate CD" ?
- can you burn a cd with an ISO?
thanks, so its probably better to install it from a CD
Live CD can boot... if you have a cd-rom that is set to boot in your bios..
------ get the ISO download, and Make the CD
if you cannot burn a bootable CD from the ISO, then get disks mailed to you
Be aware of everything before you try to use the CD
THanks , I guess I can burn it :)

-- gnome will get it done for you..

well.. You may change the MBR, and need to.. fix the MBR
